title: The Amber Room
description: A 60-second lesson on The Amber Room.

hook.text: An entire room made of six tons of amber, gold, and mirrors vanished during World War II and was never found.

buildup.text: Built in 1701 for the King of Prussia, it was gifted to Russia and installed in a palace near St. Petersburg.

discovery.text: Nazi soldiers dismantled the room in 36 hours in 1941 and shipped it to KÃ¶nigsberg Castle in Germany.

twist.text: Allied bombing destroyed the castle in 1945. Whether the room survived or burned remains unknown.

climax.text: Russia built a replica in 2003 costing $11 million. The original, worth $500 million, is still missing.

punchline.text: The most valuable room ever built has been missing for 80 years.

quiz.question: What happened to the Amber Room during World War II?
options: Nazis dismantled and shipped it, and it disappeared
